bestBHT.bht: The Jews who had accompanied Tertullus to Caesarea joined in setting upon him, affirming and bearing their testimony to the truth of the facts as alleged in court by Tertullus. They confirmed unanimously the accusation which he had brought against Paul, agreeing that the crimes he had set forth were so, in line with the steps and actions taken by the chief captain.

Henry Alford: 9. assented] joined in setting upon him, bore out Tertullus in his charges.
Albert Barnes: The Jews also assented - The Jews who had accompanied Tertullus to Caesarea.
They had gone as the accusers of Paul, and they bore testimony, when called upon, to the truth of all that the orator had said.
In whatever way their testimony was arrived at, they confirmed unanimously the accusation which he had brought against Paul.
Marvin Vincent: Assented [συνεθεντο] . But the best texts read sunepeqento, jointly set upon or assailed. So Rev., joined in the charge.
Philip Schaff: And the Jews also assailed him (or them);
They joined their voices to their advocate’s in his charges against Paul.
Bearing their testimony to the truth of the facts as alleged in court by Tertullus.
John Gill: And the Jews also assented... agreed to what Tertullus said..."
Saying, that these things were so... guilty of the crimes he had set forth...
...the chief captain had taken the steps, and done the things he had related.
